content.text1: The is our opportunity to work towards justice and peace in some of the most vulnerable places around the world. As the church, it's our responsibility to stand for people who have been marginalized by working to meet their tangible needs.
Through Peacemakers we support Mennonite Central Committee to walk with vulnerable people as they actualize their own vision for their community.

Indigenous and Settler Reconciliation in Ontario

image1.alt: A women and her baby recieve a peacemakers relief kit from an Aid Worker in Jordan.

content.text1: Peacemakers is a collective initiative. Our community is invited to donate financially in the form of Peace Cards and Relief Kits. This year our Relief Kits will be going to Jordan to people affected by the conflict in Syria.

image1.alt: A teeange boy is volunteering for the peacemakers campaign by placing relief kit items into large bucket for shipping.

content.text1: We partner with peacebuilding efforts as peace lays the foundation for communities to flourish.

This is how we live out Jesus’ message of peace and model his love for people who have been pushed to the margins. It's how we subvert the narrative that we must accumulate wealth and challenges us to think as global citizens.

list.title: By participating in this campaign we choose to give generously to efforts in our world that seek to bring healing, redemption and justice to God’s creation.
